== IRC ==
IRC is a great way for for a global team to communicate. In our different channels we take care of team business, help users, or just get to know each other better. 

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="width:100%; background:#FF8040; color:	#000000; margin: 1em 0em 0em 0em; padding: 1em;">Ubuntu Advert Channels on freenode network
| Purpose
|-
| <rowstyle="background:#F4F3F1; color:#000000"><nowiki>[[irc:--chat.freenode.net-ubuntu-adverts|#Ubuntu-Adverts]]</nowiki>
| Support and Main channel, where the magic happens
|-
| <rowstyle="background:#F4F3F1; color:#000000"><nowiki>[[irc:--chat.freenode.net-ubuntu-adverts-leaders|#Ubuntu-Adverts-Leaders]]</nowiki>
| Leadership for each section
|}

 '''If you do not have an IRC Client or are brand new to IRC you can quickly and easily sign on to our team channel <nowiki>[[ http:--webchat.freenode.net-?channels=ubuntu-adverts| #ubuntu-adverts]]</nowiki> here.'''

 
 Other IRC channels will be used for individual group meetings when scheduled. I recommend everyone be available on the #Ubuntu-Adverts channel and the team in which they contribute to. ie: If you signed up for design, you will also be on the #Ubuntu-Adverts-Design channel along with the #Ubuntu-Adverts. If you are a leader, you will be on the leadership channel along with the channel you lead, and of course our main channel.
